snippet: The number of South Sudanese fleeing for neighboring nations has reached 715,000, the United Nations refugee agency said, amid a civil war and the threat of famine.
abstract: United Nations refugee agency says number of South Sudanese fleeing for neighboring nations is expected to reach as many as 715,000 by end of 2014, more than double number envisioned when agency began a funding appeal.
lead_paragraph: The number of South Sudanese fleeing for neighboring nations has reached 715,000, the United Nations refugee agency said, amid a civil war and the threat of famine.
